item.title: Char in Go
item.description: Char in Go In Go, a character is represented by a single UTF-8 encoded Unicode code point. This is typically a 32-bit integer value, although for some code points it may be a 16-bit or 8-bit value. To declare a character variable in Go, we can use the rune type, which is an alias for the int32 type and is used to represent a single Unicode code point. For example:
